alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 7:36AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL BROWN COUNTY THROUGH 815 AM CDT... At 735 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Early, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Early, Blanket, Zephyr, and Owens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for west central Texas.
